Data: 10.10am There's a hint of light rain lurking around the ground this morning, but hopefully it'll all blow over by the start of play. Still 20 minutes to go until the toss.
10.25am The suggestion from the front line is that D'Arcy Short could be set to make his ODI debut today. Potentially a switch at the top with Travis Head, but all will be revealed shortly.
10.30am It looks as though the toss is going to be pushed back to 10.40am, but the groundstaff are still hopeful of a prompt 11am start. We shall see
Australia 1 Travis Head 2 D'Arcy Short, 3 Shaun Marsh, 4 Marcus Stoinis, 5 Glenn Maxwell, 6 Aaron Finch, 7 Tim Paine (capt & wk), 8 Ashton Agar, 9 Andrew Tye, 10 Kane Richardson, 11 Jhye Richardson
England: 1 Jonny Bairstow, 2 Jason Roy, 3 Alex Hales, 4 Joe Root, 5 Sam Billings, 6 Jos Buttler (capt & wk), 7 Moeen Ali, 8 David Willey, 9 Liam Plunkett, 10 Adil Rashid, 11 Mark Wood
Sam Billings is confirmed as Morgan's replacement.
"It's a bit overcast and it might swing," reasons Tim Paine, not unreasonably.
Heads is the correct call, and Australia will bowl. Short is in for Neser, and as flagged, Stanlake is out, Jhye Richardson comes in. He's got wheels.
10.40am Here comes the toss. But Eoin Morgan has had a back spasm. He is out of the game Jos Buttler will captain in his absence
10.47am Well, that was more dramatic than expected. Morgan's 69 was crucial to England's victory at The Oval. Two wicketkeeper-captains today, which is unusual.

10.58am Right, let's play some cricket. Out come the England openers, and you suspect that Jason Roy in particular will be grateful not to have Stanlake bearing down on him. Jhye Richardson is rapid though... this will be fun.
Jhye Richardson to Roy, 1 run decent pace first-up but sliding into the pads, Roy is off the mark with a nudge to leg
Jhye Richardson to Bairstow, no run outside off, on the back foot, punched firmly to cover

Jhye Richardson to Bairstow, FOUR runs on the toes, and that's sumptuous timing from Bairstow, clipped firmly in front of square. Everything he touches goes at the moment. (Even the balls to which he gets out...)
Jhye Richardson to Bairstow, 1 run tapped to the leg side and through they jog
Jhye Richardson to Roy, 1 run whipped to the leg side
Jhye Richardson to Bairstow, no run pushed onto the back foot and tapped back down the pitch
Kane Richardson to Roy, no run pushed onto the back foot and there's a bit of a pop from a good length. Roy rides the bounce
Kane Richardson to Roy, no run left alone outside off stump
Kane Richardson to Roy, no run through to the keeper, and left alone once more
Kane Richardson to Roy, no run on the back foot again, a half-cock drive back to the bowler
Kane Richardson to Roy, FOUR runs slammed to the fence! You can't bowl there to any international batsman, or most club batsmen, to be fair. Short, wide, and in the slot for the cut
Kane Richardson to Roy, no run leaning onto the front foot, and pushed back down the pitch
Jhye Richardson to Bairstow, FOUR runs another beautifully timed strike from Bairstow, utilising the width and extra pace, placing bat on ball, and easing it through backward point
Jhye Richardson to Bairstow, no run fuller length, tighter line, drilled to cover
Jhye Richardson to Bairstow, 1 run worked into the covers once more
Jhye Richardson to Roy, no run attempted pull, sounded like a thin snick, but it was off the underside of the arm-pit as Roy was through his shot too soon
Jhye Richardson to Roy, no run punched off the back foot, into the covers
Jhye Richardson to Roy, no run good wheels to finish the over! A brisk bouncer, Roy contemplates a pull but the ball has soared past him
Kane Richardson to Bairstow, 1 run punched firmly into the covers but a good half-stop at point ... But Maxwell looks to have landed on his shoulder there... think he's okay
Kane Richardson to Roy, no run a flowing back-foot drive, straight to the fielder but good intent from Roy once more
Kane Richardson to Roy, no run full length, hint of outswing, tucked to short midwicket
Kane Richardson to Roy, no run attempted wallop across the line, no contact this time as the ball dies through to the keeper
Kane Richardson to Roy, no run full stride, down the pitch and defended to mid-off
Kane Richardson to Roy, no run another thump into the covers
Jhye Richardson to Bairstow, no run worked to point
Jhye Richardson to Bairstow, no run a hint of late nip back into the right hander, who can't time his drive, as it inside-edges into his thigh
Jhye Richardson to Bairstow, FOUR runs that is butchered through the covers! Less movement this time, and Bairstow finds a full face, wonderful balance, on the front foot and whistling to the rope
Jhye Richardson to Bairstow, no run a bottom-handed punch but straight to short cover this time
Jhye Richardson to Bairstow, no run banged in short, but that's not too high for the umpire's liking. Well directed
Jhye Richardson to Bairstow, no run a big swish across the line but that is through to the keeper
Kane Richardson to Roy, FOUR runs panned through the covers, oodles of bottom hand, lovely ball-striking
Kane Richardson to Roy, 1 run good sharp running, England looking lively
Kane Richardson to Bairstow, no run angling into the stumps, eased out to point off the front foot
Kane Richardson to Bairstow, SIX runs nailed over long-off! That is formidable power, bottom hand coming through the line. It's a short boundary, but that would have cleared most!
Kane Richardson to Bairstow, FOUR runs flogged up and over extra cover this time! Not timed on this occasion, but Bairstow picks his spot well, finding space behind the inner ring. Expensive over...
Kane Richardson to Bairstow, FOUR runs another boundary, this time off the toes! Richardson over-compensates, slides into the pads, and is clipped imperiously in front of square
Agar to Roy, no run good areas to start, tweaking into the pads
Agar to Roy, 2 runs pushed confidently into the covers, Bairstow's rapid running ensures an easy couple
Agar to Roy, FOUR runs thwacked with intent, up and overs the covers! One, two, three bounces and into the rope. Selective and dismissive
Agar to Roy, 1 run fuller face on a more probing length, pressed back down the pitch
Agar to Bairstow, FOUR runs squashed through point, and up comes England's fifty in dismissive fashion. Too much width and tonked to the rope!
Agar to Bairstow, FOUR runs pounded over the leg side! This is getting brutal already. The early arrival of spin has just clicked England into a higher gear. In the slot and duly slotted!
Stoinis to Roy, no run punched firmly, but back to the bowler
Stoinis to Roy, 1 run outside off, an offcutter, opens the face and glides down to third man
Stoinis to Bairstow, 1 run chopped to third man, a swishing back-cut
Stoinis to Roy, 1 run cut once more
Stoinis to Bairstow, FOUR runs another back-foot biff through backward point. This is naive cricket from Australia and England are utterly flying now
Stoinis to Bairstow, no run flogged off the front foot, tighter line this time, and cover intercepts
Kane Richardson to Roy, 1 run opens the face for a dab through third man

Kane Richardson to Bairstow, OUT tighter line, Bairstow has a swish, and nicks through to the keeper! Bairstow was a victim of over-confidence there, looking to leather everything in his slot, but picking the wrong shot for that ball. The switch of ends works, and Australia have a toe-hold!
Kane Richardson to Hales, no run outside off, no stroke offered
Kane Richardson to Hales, no run through to the keeper, good tight line, slightly back of a length
Kane Richardson to Hales, no run fully forward and defended to the off side
Kane Richardson to Hales, no run onto the front foot once more
Stoinis to Roy, 1 run tucked off the pads, out to backward square leg
Stoinis to Hales, 1 run back of a length, firmly planted into the covers, and a slight misfield allows Hales to get off the mark
Stoinis to Roy, 1 run worked off the hip to square leg
Stoinis to Hales, no run pushed onto the back foot, defended back down the pitch
Stoinis to Hales, FOUR runs Hales is away, a trademark back-foot steer through point. Capitalising on too much width, and guiding it to the rope
Stoinis to Hales, 1 run banged in short, hauled into the leg side
Agar to Hales, 1 run tossed up, on the leg stump, pushed to mid-on
Agar to Roy, no run fully forward and tapped to the covers
Agar to Roy, 1 run full face and driven to the man at long-off
Agar to Hales, no run stretching forward, defended with respect back down the pitch
Agar to Hales, 1 run blocked into the covers
Agar to Roy, 1 run worked calmly into the gap at cover, a steadier second over for Agar
Stoinis to Roy, no run a bit of lift on a good length outside off, fenced to third man
Stoinis to Roy, 1 run cracked with an open face out into the covers
Stoinis to Hales, no run defended on the back foot, straight back down the pitch
Stoinis to Hales, no run back of a length, and that has lifted sharply through to the keeper! Threatening the splice as Hales keeps inside the line
Stoinis to Hales, no run flogged off the back foot, and Maxwell does well at point to cut off a certain four
Stoinis to Hales, 1 run whittled into the leg side, another single
Agar to Hales, 1 run striding onto the front foot, and pushed back past the bowler
Agar to Roy, 1 run blocked with a full face, through the gap at cover
Agar to Hales, 1 run glided off the back foot once more, dealing in singles for now just to keep things ticking over
Agar to Roy, 1 run looped up, met with a firm drive to long-off
Agar to Hales, 1 run too full, on the pads, tucked to midwicket for another single
Agar to Roy, 1 run another single into the covers
Stoinis to Roy, no run decent line and length outside off, and more extra pop from the medium-paced Stoinis. Defended
Stoinis to Roy, no run angled defence out to gully
Stoinis to Roy, 1 run defended off the back foot
Stoinis to Hales, 1 run hoisted with disdain out through deep midwicket
Stoinis to Roy, no run solid in defence once more
Stoinis to Roy, 1 run whipped off the toes, out through square leg
Agar to Roy, 1 run round the wicket, probing length, another pressed single to mid-off
Agar to Hales, no run back of a length, cracked hard to point
Agar to Hales, no run well bowled, good pace and flight, forcing Hales onto the back foot to defend
Agar to Hales, 1 run stout defence once more, good areas from Agar
Agar to Roy, 1 run chipped in the air, not timed well enough to reach the man at long-off
Agar to Hales, 1 run firmly forward to defend into the gap once more
Tye to Hales, FOUR runs thick outside edge They all count!
Tye to Hales, no run fuller and straighter, solid defence on the front foot
Tye to Hales, 1 run tucked to the leg side
Tye to Roy, 1 run banged in short, hoisted to the leg side
Tye to Hales, 1 run flipped off the toes, out to the leg side
Tye to Roy, FOUR runs over-pitched, and emphatically drilled along the ground and through the covers. A more convincing boundary to end the over, and bring up the hundred
Agar to Hales, no run big stride to defend
Agar to Hales, no run up on the toes, punched into the covers
Agar to Hales, no run opens the face and worked into the covers again
Agar to Hales, 1 run tighter line, worked to the leg side
Agar to Roy, 1 run cracked with intent along the ground, but gathered at long-off
Agar to Hales, no run on the back foot, poked back to the bowler
Tye to Roy, FOUR runs overpitched on the stumps and he launches a cross right over midwicket, skipping away to the rope for four
Tye to Roy, 1 run angled in, 78mph and worked for one
Tye to Hales, no run banged in short, Hales looks to pull but then changes his mind as the zips through above his shoulder
Tye to Hales, no run touch short, 83mph and tapped down
Tye to Hales, no run comes across to push a length ball into the off side
Tye to Hales, FOUR runs dug in again, 81mph on off stump, Hales latches on to a rasping pull shot and creams it in front of deep square leg, that's left the fielder with no chance
Jhye Richardson to Roy, no run wanged down short, 88mph and too hot for Roy as he thinks better of hooking
Jhye Richardson to Roy, 1 run rising off a length, dabbed down behind point and they scurry through as Maxwell fields to his left, whirls around and fires in a throw, misses the stumps
Jhye Richardson to Hales, no run length, 85mph and defended into the covers

Jhye Richardson to Hales, OUT oh, ripped through 'im! Richardson spears Hales with the perfect line and length, through the gate to hit the top of middle! That's Kryptonite for Hales, seaming in and sending him back to the hutch for a middling score
Jhye Richardson to Root, no run Root lines this up in defence
Jhye Richardson to Root, FOUR runs short and at the body, 88mph but that's bread and butter on the hip, Root skims it fine and beats the man on the rope to get off the mark with a four
Stoinis to Roy, FOUR runs short, 78mph and whirled on the pull for four! Superbly placed in front of the man at fine leg this time
Stoinis to Roy, 1 run tapped down into a gap, that's fifty for Roy - taken just 52 balls, politely applauded around the ground
Stoinis to Root, no run length on off, defended as he comes across
Stoinis to Root, no run driven off the back foot, nicely timed but straight to mid-off, the ball skips up off the pitch and nearly causes Marsh a mischief
Stoinis to Root, 1 run pitched up and dinked down the ground for a single
Stoinis to Roy, 1 run back of a length outside off, runs one more to third man
Jhye Richardson to Roy, no run fullish and driven coming forwards, picks out extra cover
Jhye Richardson to Roy, 1 run dabbed down, just a few yards into the off side, Roy looks to his partner and is called through for a comfortable one
Jhye Richardson to Root, FOUR runs pitched up and Root opens the face on a lovely square drive that again threads the gap for four
Jhye Richardson to Root, no run short of a length, 86mph and angling in, tucked to the leg side
Jhye Richardson to Root, no run better lines from Jhye R, 87mph and blocked on the front foot
Jhye Richardson to Root, no run full and driven coming forwards, comes off the toe of the bat back to the bowler
Stoinis to Roy, no run short ball, high and leg side - but not called wide
Stoinis to Roy, 1 run angled in and tucked off the hip
Stoinis to Root, 1 run back of a length outside off, Root steers a single through point
Stoinis to Roy, SIX runs fore! And that's six! Roy brings out his golf clubs and drives a long ball down the fairway towards the River Taff... watch out in the stands
Stoinis to Roy, 1 run full toss, 77mph on leg stump, flubbed along the ground to long-on
Stoinis to Root, 1 run dug in short, Root swivels on a pull shot for one
Jhye Richardson to Root, 2 runs shortish, 83mph outside off, Root drops deep and dabs a late cut behind point
Jhye Richardson to Root, no run full, 87mph outside off, Root punches to mid-off coming forwards
Jhye Richardson to Root, 1 run slightly short and wide and chopped away square with a horizontal bat

Jhye Richardson to Roy, FOUR runs length, Roy gets low and pushes at the ball, slightly open face... and he gets a thick edge wide of the diving Paine for four! No slip in place now, think Richardson went wide and angled it in, drew the mistake but Roy gets away with it
Jhye Richardson to Roy, no run banged in short, zipping through over the shoulder
Jhye Richardson to Roy, 1 run pitched up, 90mph in the channel, dropped through cover point for a single
Tye to Roy, 1 run slower ball, down the leg side, flicked for one
Tye to Root, no run oof, that's surprised Root, an effort ball that jumps and hits the glove/bat handle as Root fends in front of his chest
Tye to Root, 1 run length, 84mph, Root comes across and steers through point
Tye to Roy, no run hits a good length on off stump, defended with a straight bat and a big stride
Tye to Roy, FOUR runs slightly too full in the channel, 80mph and a scrambled seam, Roy is immediately back on the offensive, drilling four through extra cover
Tye to Roy, 1 run short, width for the batsman, slapped off the back foot through point
Kane Richardson to Roy, no run shortish outside off and tapped down into the covers
Kane Richardson to Roy, 1 wide back of a length, 81mph and sliding down the leg side for a wide
Kane Richardson to Roy, no run tight lines, coming back in at Roy, who can only deflect it towards backward point
Kane Richardson to Roy, 1 run this is prodded down in front of Maxwell, who hares up and has a shy at the non-striker's end, Roy judged it well
Kane Richardson to Root, 1 run fullish and punched back past the bowler
Kane Richardson to Roy, 2 runs dug in, 78mph and Roy brings out the forehand smash to get this in front of deep square leg for a couple
Kane Richardson to Roy, 1 run dropped into the covers and they scamper through, a direct hit would have been close with Root running his bat in at the striker's end
Tye to Roy, no run Roy comes across and defends a length ball
Tye to Roy, no run short, taking the pace off, 70mph outside off and Roy mistimes a cross-batted whack
Tye to Roy, SIX runs dug in, Roy is on it in a flash, pounding a brutal blow into the crowd at deep midwicket! That's the longer part of the ground to hit to, but it soared off the middle for six!
Tye to Roy, 1 run fullish and dinked into the on side for one
Tye to Root, 1 run pitched up, 78mph on middle and leg, Root works it wide of mid-on
Tye to Roy, 2 runs too straight again and this is wristily chaperoned in front of deep midwicket for a couple
Kane Richardson to Root, 1 run outside off and steered down to third man
Kane Richardson to Roy, no run touch short, 78mph and Roy mistimes into the off side
Kane Richardson to Roy, 1 run back of a length and this is helped away through midwicket with a roll of the wrists
Kane Richardson to Root, 3 runs not a bad ball from Kane-R, 84mph and on a length in the channel, but Root places it superbly on the drive past extra cover and in front of the sweeper for three
Kane Richardson to Roy, 2 runs short ball, swatted away on the pull in front of deep midwicket
Kane Richardson to Roy, no run thuds into the pads, taking the pace off, Richardson asks the question... but that was heading down
Stoinis to Root, no run full, dipping on the stumps and flicked to midwicket on the bounce
Stoinis to Root, no run this jump at Root again, 78mph and rising up to hit the splice as he fends it away
Stoinis to Root, 1 run angled in with the arm and worked through the leg side
Stoinis to Roy, 1 run pitched up, Roy hammers a drive at extra cover and Agar can't collect it first time, the ball bobbling away and they take one

Stoinis to Root, OUT pulled flat hard into the deep - but D'Arcy Short dives forward to hold a blinder! Stoinis celebrates, but credit to the catcher, a fine bit of work on his debut! Root had skipped down as the ball was banged in short, he tried to get on top of an aggressive panhandle through midwicke
Stoinis to Buttler, no run fullish length, 82mph and clipped uppishly towards mid-on
Tye to Roy, no run turned into the leg side
Tye to Roy, no run slower delivery, Roy nudges it away
Tye to Roy, no run hard length, 82mph rising outside off, steered towards backward point
Tye to Roy, 1 run taking the pace off again, 65mph and Roy is through a forcing shot early, spooned into a gap at cover for one to the sweeper
Tye to Buttler, 1 run stays back and works a single through the leg side
Tye to Roy, 1 run fuller, 85mph outside off, tip and run wide of mid-off and they make it through comfortably
Stoinis to Roy, no run length ball around off stump, jabbed into the covers
Stoinis to Roy, no run slightly short, 77mph and he shows it a straight bat on off stump
Stoinis to Roy, 1 run angled in a little straighter and Roy punches one down the ground
Stoinis to Buttler, no run banged in back of a length, stops in the pitch slightly and Buttler take a blow on his hip pulling across the line
Stoinis to Buttler, no run length ball in the channel, dabbed behind square
Stoinis to Buttler, 1 run short and pulled away through square leg for one... and the rain is tipping down again now
Short to Buttler, 1 run lobs up a full toss from over the wicket, Buttler twocks it down the ground for one
Short to Roy, no run nicely flighted, bit of spin back into Roy as he presses forward, hit on the knee roll
Short to Roy, 1 run tossed up on leg stump, Roy gets low and swats a sweep to fine leg
Short to Buttler, 2 runs now Buttler shuffles across and paddles the ball away, gets it fine and they come back for two
Short to Buttler, 2 runs lobbed up and tucked square, into a gap again and there's another brace for Buttler, showing placement instead of power here
Short to Buttler, FOUR runs now comes the hurt, floated up wide of off stump and Buttler drills four through the covers to cap a good over for England, back in their groove already
Stoinis to Roy, no run good length, 80mph on off stump and Roy defends watchfully back to the bowler
Stoinis to Roy, FOUR runs short ball, into his arc and Roy slugs it up and away over mid-on for four
Stoinis to Roy, 1 run full on the stumps, punched back past the bowler, mid-off comes across
Stoinis to Buttler, 2 runs back of a length on off stump, not a bad delivery but Buttler forces it in front off deep cover off the back foot for a couple
Stoinis to Buttler, no run dug in, 78mph, Buttler rides the bounce and dabs to short third man
Stoinis to Buttler, 2 runs short again, this time Buttler plays a controlled pull in front of deep midwicket for a couple
Agar to Roy, 1 run round the wicket, tossed up on off and poked into a gap
Agar to Buttler, 1 run flighted, Buttler gets on to the front foot and drives wide of long-off, just one
Agar to Roy, 1 run angled in and punched through mid-off, Roy moves on to 99
Agar to Buttler, no run on the stumps and tapped to midwicket
Agar to Buttler, 1 run quicker delivery, stabbed through the covers for a single to the sweeper

Agar to Roy, 2 runs floated up outide off, Roy steps across and steers the ball square, calls for two and celebrates his fifth ODI hundred after getting back comfortably... A fine innings from Roy, ending a run of middling scores
Stoinis to Buttler, no run Buttler prods at the ball, gets a thin, low edge through to the keeper on the bounce
Stoinis to Buttler, 2 runs short and pulled, wide of the man at fine leg for a couple
Stoinis to Buttler, 1 run fullish, 82mph and pushed down the ground to long-on
Stoinis to Roy, 1 run full toss outside off, just a single via a bottom-handed slap through the covers
Stoinis to Buttler, 2 runs pitched up and driven square for a couple more
Stoinis to Buttler, FOUR runs slower ball, Buttler is on to the front foot and lofts it over extra cover, smoothly done and it bounces away to the rope
Agar to Roy, 2 runs tossed up into the toes, clipped square
Agar to Roy, no run pressed forward on the front foot, a slight inside-edge into the crease
Agar to Roy, FOUR runs reverse-swept, and impeccably so! Fizzes away through backward point. Hard to defend that one
Agar to Roy, 1 run stabbing forward, deflected to backward square and that's a good decisive call from Buttler
Agar to Buttler, 1 run on the back foot, tapped to cover
Agar to Roy, 1 run deflected down through third man
Tye to Roy, FOUR runs over-pitched outside off, and that is lambasted back past the bowler!
Tye to Roy, no run tucked to the leg side, as Roy picks the slower ball
Tye to Roy, 1 wide pushed down the leg side and that's a nasty bounce into Tim Paine's face! The ball just kicked off the turf as he stooped to gather, and he had no place to go.
Tye to Roy, 2 runs back of a length, slower ball, slapped behind point and good running too
Tye to Roy, FOUR runs a flamboyant drive through the covers! Flogged on the up, pierces the field. All of these breaks are doing nothing to disrupt Roy's momentum

Tye to Roy, OUT that, on the other hand, will do very nicely! A cross-seamer from Tye, zipping into the right-hander, catching the toe of the bat as it does so, and what a take from Paine! Changing direction to fling himself down the leg-side, and grabbing in one hand. Quite the recovery from his blow in
Tye to Billings, no run beats the edge, another knuckleball, and Paine wears this one on the chest as it zips through on the second bounce. Awkward times behind the stumps
Agar to Buttler, no run pushed straight back to the bowler
Agar to Buttler, no run solidly into line
Agar to Buttler, no run drawn forward to defend
Agar to Buttler, 1 run hitting inside-out, to deep point
Agar to Billings, 1 run outside off, cut firmly to backward point
Agar to Buttler, no run another cut, zipped through a bit flatter, and gathered at backward point
Short to Billings, 1 run paddle-sweep from Billings, a bit of a top-edge, but he's off the strike safely enough
Short to Buttler, 1 run poked into the covers, finding the gap once more
Short to Billings, no run good delivery, a full-length outswinger, and pushed back to the bowler
Short to Billings, 2 runs leg-sided, dipping into the batsman's pads as he sweeps fine. Good sliding stop from Jichardson
Short to Billings, no run up on the toes, punched to cover
Short to Billings, no run stretching forward in defence, and gathered with a scramble by Maxwell
Agar to Buttler, no run round the wicket, cramped for room on the pads
Agar to Buttler, 2 runs a bit more width as Buttler stays leg-sided and clobbers a drive into the covers
Agar to Buttler, no run fully forward, head over the ball, and defended
Agar to Buttler, 1 run dipping late, blocked to cover for another single
Agar to Billings, no run back of a length and quicker through the air, bounces sharply as Billings pokes off the back foot
Agar to Billings, 1 run inside-edged defence to the man on the 45. Good control from Australia for the moment
Short to Billings, no run back of a length, tweaking into the right hander, can't get the angle into a back-foot push
Short to Billings, no run swept, but misses everything
Short to Billings, 1 run another attempted sweep, on a leg-stump line, an under-edge from Billings. He gets the single, but isn't looking settled yet
Short to Buttler, 2 leg byes tucked fine, off the pads, doesn't have the pace to reach the rope as backward square gallops round to gather
Short to Buttler, no run beaten outside off, another grope at nothing
Short to Buttler, 1 run a roundhouse hoick to the leg side. Excellent work from the leggie
Jhye Richardson to Buttler, FOUR runs crashed through the covers! That is sweet timing, the sweeper didn't have far to go, but there was no intercepting that!
Jhye Richardson to Buttler, SIX runs ramped for six! The reinjection of pace has reinjected Buttler's innings!
Jhye Richardson to Buttler, SIX runs exhibition stuff from Buttler! Walking across his stumps, using the pace on the full length, and leaning it into the fine leg sightscreen!
Jhye Richardson to Buttler, 2 runs back of a length, a murderous cut shot ... gathered by the sweeper but not before Buttler has brought up his fifty with a sudden burst of energy!
Jhye Richardson to Buttler, 1 run slower ball, on the legs, clipped fine
Jhye Richardson to Billings, 1 run forward and drilled into the covers
Short to Billings, no run misses out on a sweep
Short to Billings, 2 runs good diving stop on the cover boundary
Short to Billings, 1 run swept to fine leg
Short to Buttler, FOUR runs another exocet of a cover drive! He is utterly nailing those at the moment, in all formats
Short to Buttler, no run back of a length, pushed to mid-on
Short to Buttler, 1 run notches up the single to long on
Kane Richardson to Buttler, 1 run on the back foot, tucked back down the pitch
Kane Richardson to Willey, 1 run outside off, fenced down into the crease and gathered behind the stumps
Kane Richardson to Buttler, no run very full, attempted wipe down the ground but can't really connect
Kane Richardson to Buttler, 1 run wider line outside off, and chopped to cover
Kane Richardson to Willey, 1 run wide full-toss, carved down to third man. A good gather on the boundary's edge by Marsh. Willey is a bit miffed that that wasn't a no-ball
Kane Richardson to Buttler, 1 run drilled to cover
Jhye Richardson to Buttler, 1 run banged in short, through to the keeper
Jhye Richardson to Willey, 1 leg bye a swish into the leg side, but can't connect properly. They settle for the scampered single
Jhye Richardson to Buttler, 2 runs cracked hard into the leg side, taking on the short ball, and not quite timing it. Lands safe in no-man's land

Jhye Richardson to Buttler, 1 run attempted ramp, Richardson adapts his line, so Buttler jabs the toe of his bat at the ball to pick off the single to third man. Impressive ninja skills for the single
Jhye Richardson to Willey, 1 leg bye attempted swish from a full length, can't connect once more. Australia are brawling well at the death
Jhye Richardson to Buttler, 1 leg bye slower ball, short of a length, into the body, deflects to leg
Tye to Buttler, FOUR runs back of a length, walloped through backward square. He's in the mood now!
Tye to Buttler, 1 run fuller length, met under the eyeline, and crunched up to mid-off
Tye to Billings, 1 wide swinging down the leg side, another extra to the cause
Tye to Billings, 1 run solidly drilled down to long-off
Tye to Buttler, 1 run pushed out to the off side, another fifty stand
Tye to Billings, OUT inside-edge onto the stumps! The slower ball does for Billings ... he never got going really, failed to pick the variation and shivered his own timbers
Tye to Ali, FOUR runs short and slapped in front of square! Moeen is not going to hang around, and he's got licence to wallop today! This could be fun ...
Jhye Richardson to Buttler, no run attempted wipe through the leg side, but that one is through him too quickly
Jhye Richardson to Buttler, no run down the leg side, but Buttler is walking across the stumps and can't make contact
Jhye Richardson to Buttler, no run a flat-batted mow, straight down the ground and into the non-striker's stumps
Jhye Richardson to Buttler, 1 run slower ball, Buttler uses the lack of pace to glide one down to third man
Jhye Richardson to Ali, 1 run back of a length, tapped into the covers
Jhye Richardson to Buttler, no run a swish across the line, can't make contact. A lull in England's tempo in that over
Kane Richardson to Buttler, 1 run slower ball, top-edged over the keeper
Kane Richardson to Willey, FOUR runs that's in Willey's slot! A bit of a half-tracker outside off, and panned back whence it came, through long off
Kane Richardson to Willey, FOUR runs short, swished, top-edged, more runs!
Kane Richardson to Willey, no run wide of off stump, a stand-and-deliver wipe from Willey, but can't connect
Kane Richardson to Willey, OUT banged in short again, and Richardson does brilliantly to hurtle out to point in his followthrough to complete the caught and bowled! England's flaccid finale continues
Kane Richardson to Buttler, FOUR runs ... but it's Buttler who plunks this one! Clean through midwicket as Richardson bangs it in short.
Tye to Plunkett, 1 wide sharp bouncer ... good thinking, but it's too short as Plunkett tries to wipe one off his eyebrows
Tye to Plunkett, 1 run slashed off the full length, down to third man. Buttler back on strike ...
Tye to Buttler, 1 run short and slapped to mid-on, a bit scuffed, but they take the single

Tye to Plunkett, OUT whoops, a mistimed wipe to the leg side, a non-existent single, but Plunkett figures it's better to get Buttler back on strike. He's not even in the frame as the bails are whipped off. Fair play!
Tye to Buttler, 2 runs short, slapped down the ground, back they come for two. This innings may appear to have petered out ... but it is still their highest ODI total against Australia!
Tye to Buttler, FOUR runs finds the gap, off the toe of the bat, chasing the wide ball, but picks out the long boundary for one more boundary!
Tye to Buttler, FOUR runs bouncer, banged in short, banged out through the leg side! Buttler finds the final flourish to set Australia an imposing total target of 343!

3.49pm Well, that was a curious innings. Record-breaking on the one hand, but oddly underwhelming on the other. It's a measure of the heightened expectations around this England team, I guess. But credit to Australia for hauling the runaway train back in the latter overs. It's a quick turnaround after the rain.

Howdy, folks. Here come the Australia openers in Cardiff... Meanwhile, it's still kicking off in St Lucia; or rather, it isn't, with Sri Lanka so far refusing to play after the umpires changed the ball and hit them with a five-run penalty
David Willey to start off from the Cathedral End, two slips in
Willey to Head, FOUR runs shortish and sliding leg side, Head tickles it off his hip and that'll be four from the first ball
Willey to Head, no run that's a beauty to follow up, swinging away late as Head closes the face and is beaten
Willey to Head, no run length, 82mph in the channel, lets this one shape away and through to the keeper
Willey to Head, no run angled in straighter, Head works the ball to mid-on
Willey to Head, FOUR runs fired in full, looking for swing but it drifts on to the pads and Head skelps it past short fine leg and away for four more
Willey to Head, no run back of a length, 77mph and chopped into the ground as he hops across
Wood to Short, 1 wide sprints in like a javelin thrower and spears this down the leg side to start with
Wood to Short, 2 runs touch short and nudged off the hip, Hales runs across at square leg... and then slips over, allowing them to come back for a second
Wood to Short, no run back of a length, 86mph around off stump and pushed gently into the covers
Wood to Short, 1 run banged in, 89mph and targeting the ribs, Short tucks it away to fine leg for a single
Wood to Head, no run angled across the bows, good pace and carry and Head lets this one go
Wood to Head, SIX runs bumper, 89mph and Head plays this beautifully, flicking up his hands at the last minute to send the ball sailing into the sight screen over the keeper's end

Wood to Head, no run thuds into the pads, England go up for lbw... Alex Wharf shakes his head, but Buttler goes to the DRS, they think that's a good shout against Head. However, Hawk-Eye quickly demonstrates the ball pitched outside leg stump, so England lose their review and Head keeps his wicket
Willey to Short, no run length outside off, teasing the batsman, Short leaves
Willey to Short, 1 leg bye touch short, 83mph and sliding in to deflect off the thigh pad, runs away square and they steal a leg bye
Willey to Head, no run length ball on off, Head pushes it back to the bowler
Willey to Head, no run good lines from Willey, 84mph on fourth stump and Head strokes it to mid-off
Willey to Head, no run finds a testing area again, this nibbles away a fraction off the pitch, into the gloves as Head fiddles outside off
Willey to Head, 1 run gets a little straighter, 82mph and it's calmly tucked through square to the man outside the ring for one
Wood to Head, FOUR runs short and wide and crunched through point, poor ball and he belts the cover off it

Wood to Head, OUT flicked into the leg side, uppish but dying in front of midwicket... where Hales scoops up a brilliant one-handed catch! That is a superb effort, throwing himself forward and low to his right! They are going to check with the TV umpire, but the soft signal is out. Yep, Dharmasena is happ
Wood to Marsh, no run stays round the wicket, pitched up at 89mph, defended coming across
Wood to Marsh, no run angling in with the arm, blocked on off stump
Wood to Marsh, no run back of a length, 86mph and whirring in, turned towards short midwicket
Wood to Marsh, 1 run comes across on off stump, opens the face and runs a single behind point
Willey to Marsh, no run tight stuff from Willey, Marsh shows it a straight bat on off stump
Willey to Marsh, no run comes across and taps watchfully away
Willey to Marsh, 3 runs just a touch too full this time and Marsh plays this nicely, eased through the covers for three
Willey to Short, no run in the channel, this doesn't really swing and Short has a flat-footed yahoo, plays all around it
Willey to Short, no run length on the stumps, Short chops it back down the track
Willey to Short, no run touch wider, 82mph and steered towards point
Wood to Marsh, no run fired in straight, Wood goes down in his follow through but is able to pick up the ball as it is rolled gently back towards him by Marsh
Wood to Marsh, 1 run short, swung away down the leg side, off the bottom edge and fine leg cleans up
Wood to Short, no run back of a length, 85mph around fourth stump, Head defends
Wood to Short, no run good length, 88mph and it clips the inside edge as Short presses forward
Wood to Short, no run angled in and worked back towards mid-on
Wood to Short, 2 runs dug in short and flicked off the body, couple through backward square leg

Willey to Marsh, no run dropped! This one doesn't stick, despite a fabulous effort from Bairstow... Marsh struck it firmly off his pads, it flew to short midwicket but went just as quickly to ground. Barely any time to react
Willey to Marsh, FOUR runs bit of width and Marsh times the ears off this, absolutely pinged through backward point
Willey to Marsh, 1 run fired in, 83mph and worked off the pads
Willey to Short, no run pitched up, 85mph and driven, Willey gets a hand on it in his follow through and it dribbles to mid-off
Willey to Short, 1 run dug in short, 84mph and Short mistimes a pull, it loops wide of short fine leg as Rashid gives chase
Willey to Marsh, 1 run pitched up and leathered on the drive, Root flings himself at extra cover and gets a hand on it
Wood to Marsh, no run back of a length, 85mph and tucked to the leg side
Wood to Marsh, no run fullish, stroked into the covers
Wood to Marsh, 1 wide Wood fires this down the leg side
Wood to Marsh, no run better length, worked off the pads to midwicket
Wood to Marsh, no run short ball, Marsh pulls but it comes off the glove and bobbles to the right of the keeper
Wood to Marsh, no run in the channel, hits the pitch hard and Marsh fails to connect
Wood to Marsh, FOUR runs dug in, 85mph, Marsh latches on to the pull and slots it away through backward square leg for four
Willey to Short, 1 run short of a length, tucked off the legs and fielded by Rashid running up from short fine
Willey to Marsh, no run good length, 81mph on off stump, defended towards point
Willey to Marsh, 2 runs touch wide, 83mph on a length and Marsh is able to reach out and open the face for a couple to the left of third man
Willey to Marsh, no run fuller, gets him driving, sends it along the ground to point
Willey to Marsh, 1 run touch short and leg side, 80mph, deflected off the inside edge for one
Willey to Short, 1 run slower ball, Short gets forward and checks it towards mid-off, they scuttle through for the single
Plunkett to Short, FOUR runs fired into the pitch cross seam, short and leg side and Short gets it away past the man on the ring for his first boundary - that brings the Australia 50 up
Plunkett to Short, no run back of a length and angled across, chopped towards point
Plunkett to Short, FOUR runs drifts on to the pads again, Short only needs to tickle this away to fine leg for four more
Plunkett to Short, 1 run still leg side, 82mph and flicked away in front of short fine leg, just a single
Plunkett to Marsh, no run gets this on a better line, outside off stump to the left-hander, pushed into the covers
Plunkett to Marsh, 3 runs back of a length and worked off the hips again, wide of short fine leg and deep square ends up coming around to cut it off
Ali to Marsh, 1 run round the wicket, pushed through and chopped into the covers, where a misfield gives them one
Ali to Short, no run flighted, Short pushes a little tentatively and pops the ball short of Roy in the covers
Ali to Short, 1 run tossed up outside off, punched through cover point
Ali to Marsh, no run looped up and tapped back to the bowler
Ali to Marsh, 1 run pushed through on off stump, Marsh punches into the covers
Ali to Short, no run length ball, straightening on off stump, Short jabs it down in front of slip
Plunkett to Marsh, no run length outside off, 83mph and Marsh pushes it back past the bowler, mid-off comes across
Plunkett to Marsh, no run skiddy, on a length and hitting the pads, Plunkett goes up for lbw... Wharf again shakes his head. Pitched outside leg, possibly inside edge, as well
Plunkett to Marsh, 2 leg byes too straight, he's flicked fine once again, Wood does terrifically down on the rope, however, to prevent four
Plunkett to Marsh, 2 runs round the wicket now, flicked through backward square leg
Plunkett to Marsh, no run angled in with the arm and Marsh defends to the on side
Plunkett to Marsh, no run touch short, 83mph and tapped down to leg
Ali to Short, no run pushed through, gripping a touch as Short goes back and mistimes a cut
Ali to Short, 1 run comes across and pushes one into the covers
Ali to Marsh, no run dropped! Taken on the full and flicked to midwicket, where the substitute Tom Curran is fielding, hits the fingertips and goes down
Ali to Marsh, 1 run Marsh steps out and pushes a single down the ground
Ali to Short, 1 run flat on the stumps and worked away into the leg side
Ali to Marsh, 1 run floated up on off, Marsh cushions the ball wide of extra cover and they scurry through
Root to Marsh, 1 run floated up from round the wicket, turned through the leg side
Root to Short, no run round arm, drifting in on to off stump, Marsh digs it out
Root to Short, 1 run floated up full, driven to long-on for a single
Root to Marsh, 1 run flatter outside off and Marsh dinks one into a gap in front of point
Root to Short, no run tossed up and flipped back down the track to the bowler
Root to Short, no run slung down on middle and off, Short can only tap it away
Ali to Marsh, 2 runs pushed through and Marsh drills it down the ground, Bairstow has to run across from long-off... but he dives across to prevent four
Ali to Marsh, 1 run pushed through and steered into the off side for one
Ali to Short, no run tossed up, punched to extra cover
Ali to Short, no run floated up slower and stroked to extra cover again

Ali to Short, OUT bit of turn, Short plays back, edged and snapped up at slip! Moeen strikes again, he's enjoying bowling to Australia... Short hadn't looked particularly adept, he had his struggles in the IPL, of course, and now he's heading back for 21 off 33 on ODI debut
Ali to Stoinis, 1 run over the wicket, floated up full and he gets down low to paddle one around the corner
Root to Stoinis, 1 run stays round the wicket to the right-hander, lobbed up and tucked off the pads
Root to Marsh, 1 run drifting in a touch with the arm, Marsh punches a drive past extra cover
Root to Stoinis, no run flighted, nice and slow and pitching on middle stump, Stoinis defends
Root to Stoinis, 1 run pushed through quicker, goes back and nurdles one in front of square on the leg side
Root to Marsh, no run tossed up on off, tapped into the covers
Root to Marsh, no run tight lines, gripping a smidgen and Marsh defends
Ali to Stoinis, no run flat, spinning in a touch, Stoinis defends
Ali to Stoinis, no run flighted, comes on to the front foot and blocks towards extra cover
Ali to Stoinis, 1 run floated up, Stoinis works it back past the bowler
Ali to Stoinis, no run on the stumps, Stoinis shows it a straight bat
Ali to Stoinis, 1 run touch short and turning down the leg side, jabbed away to deep backward square but there's only a single there
Root to Stoinis, no run slung down from round the wicket, tucked back to the bowler
Root to Stoinis, no run angled across and patted to extra cover
Root to Stoinis, 1 run darted on middle and leg, clipped through square

Root to Marsh, SIX runs humpty, at last! Marsh dances down and slots a sweet lofted drive over long-on for six! First one of the innings - first boundary in eight overs, in fact. And it has damaged the ball, so there is going to be a delay
Root to Marsh, no run tucked to the leg side
Root to Marsh, 1 run played right under the eyeline, clipped to the leg side
Rashid to Marsh, 1 run on the back foot, pushed on the up to the leg side
Rashid to Stoinis, no run solid defence on the back foot
Rashid to Stoinis, 2 runs punched in the air, playing with the spin, a checked drive over cover
Rashid to Stoinis, 1 wide googly, but sliding past the pads
Rashid to Stoinis, 1 run blocked with a straight bat, an inside-edge deflects past square leg
Rashid to Marsh, 2 runs outside off, and cut hard through deep point
Rashid to Marsh, no run stretching forward to defend into the leg side
Plunkett to Stoinis, no run tucked to short midwicket
Plunkett to Stoinis, no run through to the keeper, on a full length with nice shape off the seam

Plunkett to Stoinis, OUT bosh! Back of a length, skids through Stoinis's defences, and into the stumps via an inside edge! Plunkett rewarded for hitting the length and extracting natural variation. Definitely kept low but it was a cross-seamer which exacerbated the lack of bounce
Plunkett to Finch, 4 leg byes too straight, flicked fine, off the pad but that'll do nicely for Australia
Plunkett to Finch, no run good length, attacking the stumps from back of a length, hurried defence on the back foot
Plunkett to Finch, no run this one bursts past the edge! Lovely follow-up, similar length, but really climbs off the deck. The cross-seamer paying dividends for Plunkett
Rashid to Marsh, 2 runs thrashed on the up, out through backward point
Rashid to Marsh, no run big stride forward to defend
Rashid to Marsh, FOUR runs crashed on the up through the leg side. Top strike
Rashid to Marsh, 1 run tucked out to midwicket
Rashid to Maxwell, 1 run tossed up, dipping into Maxwell's drive, pushed to cover
Plunkett to Maxwell, no run solid block back down the pitch
Plunkett to Maxwell, no run worked back to the bowler on the front foot
Plunkett to Maxwell, no run pushed with hard hands and this one zips off the seam and nearly takes Buttler off his feet as he gathers! Sharp bowling!
Plunkett to Maxwell, no run nipping back into the right hander from just back of a length
Plunkett to Maxwell, no run thuds the pad, sliding down the leg side
Plunkett to Maxwell, 2 runs on the legs, clipped firmly out to deep midwicket
Rashid to Marsh, FOUR runs flogged hard through the covers, that's a confident strike, dancing down to meet the pitch on a wide line, and cracking it hard along the ground
Rashid to Marsh, 3 runs back of a length, punched in a similar direction off the back foot this time
Rashid to Maxwell, 1 run firmly driven, along the ground to cover
Rashid to Marsh, no run tossed up, a googly on a leg-stump line to the left-hander, and blocked
Rashid to Marsh, 2 runs another wrong'un, pushed to cover and they run a cheeky two as Curran the sub fumbles in the deep
Rashid to Marsh, no run flipped to leg, another googly
Plunkett to Maxwell, no run full length and pushed back to the bowler
Plunkett to Maxwell, no run on the back foot, tucked to the leg side
Plunkett to Maxwell, no run driven with an open face, out to point
Plunkett to Maxwell, FOUR runs short and flogged hard through square leg, that's good intent. Picking the length early and hauling it round the corner
Plunkett to Maxwell, 1 run tapped firmly down the ground, a sharp single
Plunkett to Marsh, FOUR runs short, wide, and slapped hard through the covers! That sat up and begged, and it completes a decent over for Australia
Rashid to Maxwell, FOUR runs in the slot, and tonked mightily out to the longest part of the ground, at wide long-on... a couple of bounces and another boundary
Rashid to Maxwell, 2 runs on the legs, nudged out to deep square leg
Rashid to Maxwell, no run looped into the toes, Maxwell gives himself room to stay leg-side and drive into the covers
Rashid to Maxwell, 2 runs met on the full, on the front foot, another urgent bit of running as Rashid chases out to midwicket
Rashid to Maxwell, no run poked in the air out to short cover
Rashid to Maxwell, FOUR runs tremendous batting! A feint to leg, then a booming lofted drive, high over the covers. Maxwell isn't giving this one up
Plunkett to Marsh, no run round the wicket, a speared-in yorker, cracks Marsh on the toe but that's heading down leg. Lovely length though
Plunkett to Marsh, 1 run angled in from round the wicket once more, and fenced down to third man
Plunkett to Maxwell, FOUR runs slashed, edged, four! That's a surefire way to reduce the requirement! No defending against that stroke
Plunkett to Maxwell, 1 run pushed uppishly, back past the bowler
Plunkett to Marsh, no run angled in, worked to leg
Plunkett to Marsh, 1 run fenced down to third man
Ali to Marsh, 2 runs glided out to deep cover
Ali to Marsh, no run on the back foot, cracked into the covers
Ali to Marsh, 1 run down the pitch, pushed to the off side, they scamper through
Ali to Maxwell, no run blocked on the front foot
Ali to Maxwell, 1 run clipped out to square leg
Ali to Marsh, no run straightens on a leg-stump line and flicked fine
Wood to Maxwell, 1 run back of a length, punched into the covers
Wood to Marsh, 1 run on the pads, tucked out to the leg side
Wood to Maxwell, no run pace! Maxwell shapes for the drive, then reflexively flings his neck backwards as the ball bursts off the seam and past the edge!
Wood to Maxwell, 1 run pushed firmly to mid-off and they rush through
Wood to Marsh, 1 run opens the face on a slower delivery, and glides the single to third man
Wood to Maxwell, 1 run back of a length, fenced down to third man. A decent over, nothing loose, but Australia press on
Ali to Maxwell, 1 run pushed with a full face down to long-on
Ali to Marsh, no run well bowled Moeen! Just back of a length, tweaking past the edge, and Buttler whips off the bails. No-one seems too excited, but the umpire is taking a look. On we go
Ali to Marsh, no run on the pads, tapped to the leg side
Ali to Marsh, no run forward and blocked to cover
Ali to Marsh, no run forward and defended to the off side
Ali to Marsh, no run down on the sweep as Marsh is rapped on the pad but that's heading down leg. No matter, it's a fine over, just the single from it
Wood to Maxwell, no run back of a length, skidding into a solid block
Wood to Maxwell, 1 leg bye on the pads, worked to the leg side
Wood to Marsh, 1 leg bye on the hip, and flinched to the leg side
Wood to Maxwell, no run very full, attacking the stumps with skiddy pace, and driven hard to mid-on
Wood to Maxwell, 1 leg bye sliding into the pads on a full length, no room to free the arms
Wood to Marsh, no run round the wicket, back of a length, pulled hard but just short of Root at short midwicket! He did brilliantly to gather cleanly, that was travelling
Ali to Maxwell, no run blocked to leg
Ali to Marsh, FOUR runs round the wicket and that is a tremendous strike! Just back of a length with too much width, and out comes a flowing back-foot punch through the covers
Ali to Marsh, 1 run forward and blocked into the off side
Ali to Agar, 1 run tossed up once more, on a fuller length to the new batsman, who defends to mid-off to get off the mark
Ali to Marsh, FOUR runs good delivery, pops and straightens on a good length, and an involuntary jab through third man rolls all the way to the rope
Wood to Agar, no run full and outside off, a loose drive flashes at nothing and Buttler gathers
Wood to Agar, no run banged in short, Agar's feet go nowhere as he defends down into the crease
Wood to Agar, no run fizzed through to the keeper, back of a length, but well enough directed to avoid being called wide
Wood to Agar, no run driven with an open face out to cover
Wood to Agar, no run short, and through to the keeper again. Wood's got his length spot on for the bouncer
Wood to Agar, 1 run pushed to cover, an automatic run, but Bairstow gathers cleanly and a direct hit would have been very tight!
Ali to Agar, 1 run round the wicket, outside off, cracked into the covers on the front foot
Ali to Marsh, no run pushed into the off side once more
Ali to Marsh, 1 run tip and run, out to point once more
Ali to Agar, 1 run forward and drilled out to cover
Ali to Marsh, 1 run angled into the off side again, more good fielding but sharp running
Ali to Agar, 1 run tossed up, compactly driven to mid-off
Willey to Agar, 2 runs short, and flashed in the air down to third man, a lot of runs coming on the off side at present, testament to England's good llines
Willey to Agar, 1 run cracked hard to deep cover, gathered by Billings as they jog another single
Willey to Marsh, 3 runs flipped through the leg side, on the pads for a change, and it's a long chase to pick that up behind square
Willey to Agar, 1 run jagging into the left-hander, worked off the hip
Willey to Marsh, 1 wide down the leg side, we'll have that one again
Willey to Marsh, no run blocked to cover, solid off-stump line
Willey to Marsh, 1 run on the back foot, squeezed out to backward point and a direct hit would have been close! But Roy's shy goes wide
Ali to Marsh, no run tossed up straight, Marsh leans out and defends on middle and leg
Ali to Marsh, 1 run comes forward and stokes one through cover
Ali to Agar, no run pushed through and tapped back
Ali to Agar, FOUR runs tasty from Agar, gets his first boundary with a languid slap over extra cover, beats the boundary rider
Ali to Agar, no run shows intent again, gets forward and punches back down the track
Ali to Agar, 1 run touch short, Agar swats one past the bowler to keep the strike
Willey to Agar, FOUR runs that's another sweet strike, just a fraction short and wide from Willey and Agar slashes it wide of third man for four more
Willey to Agar, 1 run back of a length, frees the arms again, bit top-edgey but it bounces safely down to third man
Willey to Marsh, 1 run straighter line from the left-armer, worked to the leg side
Willey to Agar, no run rising from just back of a length, Agar drops into the crease but chops to backward point
Willey to Agar, no run on the stumps, punched in front of mid-on
Willey to Agar, 1 run short of a length and swiped down the ground off the back foot
Ali to Agar, 1 run pushed through on the stumps, pulled into the leg side for one
Ali to Marsh, FOUR runs that's a lovely bit of batting, footwork and timing as he comes down and whips a full delivery in front of deep midwicket for four
Ali to Marsh, 1 run worked into a gap for one
Ali to Agar, no run plays with a straight bat back down the track
Ali to Agar, no run pushed through, Agar swats at the ball and gets an inside edge
Ali to Agar, 1 run makes a bit of room to carve the single
Plunkett to Agar, 1 run round the wicket, worked away off the pads
Plunkett to Marsh, FOUR runs super stuff from Marsh again, just a back-foot punch but he sends it racing fine of mid-on and away... just a shot from his hundred, now
Plunkett to Marsh, no run length ball, defended into the off side
Plunkett to Marsh, FOUR runs there it is, a firm clip off the pads and Marsh has his hundred - fourth overall and first since 2013. Can he go on to see this chase home?
Plunkett to Marsh, 1 run keeps ticking over, nudging another single
Plunkett to Agar, no run banged in short and Agar ducks underneath
Root to Marsh, no run round the wicket and pushed through, sliced off the back foot
Root to Marsh, 2 runs tossed up and driven square coming across
Root to Marsh, no run flat on the stumps, tapped back to the bowler
Root to Marsh, 1 leg bye lobbed up full and drifting leg side, Marsh sweeps and gets it away off the pads
Root to Agar, FOUR runs bit of width, Agar uses his long levers to slap the ball up and over extra cover, it beats the sweeper on the off side
Root to Agar, FOUR runs and another, this time rocking back to crunch a pull square! Again he connects powerfully and gets it past the boundary rider
Plunkett to Marsh, 1 run short and at the ribs, Marsh rides it and tucks the single
Plunkett to Agar, no run good pace, scrambled seam and the ball climbs past the top edge as Agar tries to cut on off stump
Plunkett to Agar, 1 wide fired down the leg side, Buttler appeals but he wasn't close to hitting that
Plunkett to Agar, no run short outside off, Agar cuts into the ground towards backward point
Plunkett to Agar, no run low bounce, scooting through in the channel as Agar swings and misses
Plunkett to Agar, FOUR runs gets the boundary Australia need, short and leg side and Agar swats it away to fine leg, grins at the bowler
Plunkett to Agar, no run on the stumps, pushed back down the track
Rashid to Marsh, 1 run tossed up and worked down the ground for one
Rashid to Agar, 1 run over the wicket, flighted on the stumps, Agar plays with the turn as Rashid gives chase
Rashid to Marsh, 1 run tossed up full outside off, Marsh prods through the covers
Rashid to Agar, 1 run gives it some air, slugged down the ground to long-off on the bounce
Rashid to Marsh, 1 run drops back and whips the ball with the turn through the leg side

Rashid to Agar, FOUR runs flat, wide of the stumps and Agar slaps a cut, straight to backward point... but Plunkett lets it through him to give up four! Australia clinging to the coat tails of this chase, but they're still alive!
Wood to Marsh, SIX runs short ball, Marsh seizes on it, hammers a pull into the stands a deep midwicket! That was absolutely smoked
Wood to Marsh, 1 run pitched up a bit more and worked off the legs
Wood to Agar, no run goes over the wicket to Agar, who sits back and chops the ball toward backward point
Wood to Agar, 1 run dug in short and Agar pulls in the air, bounces towards deep square leg
Wood to Marsh, 1 wide round the wicket, fired down the leg side
Wood to Marsh, 1 leg bye takes the pace off, short and rising up to hit Marsh on the body as he swings and misses
Wood to Agar, FOUR runs half-tracker outside off from Wood and Agar flat-bats it down the ground through mid-off for four more!
Rashid to Marsh, 1 run tossed up and worked into the leg side
Rashid to Paine, 1 run lobs up a legbreak from over the wicket, spinning away and chopped through the covers for one to get off the mark first ball
Rashid to Marsh, 2 runs pushed through, Marsh swipes down the ground and they get a second on the misfield
Rashid to Marsh, 1 run floated up and worked down the ground to long-on
Rashid to Paine, 1 run flat on the stumps, Paine clips a single off his hip
Wood to Paine, 1 wide length, sliding down the leg side, Buttler appeals for the catch... bit of kidology, as there was not bat involved
Wood to Paine, 1 leg bye short and on the hips, deflected wide of the keeper
Wood to Marsh, 2 runs full on the stumps, whipped into a gap at midwicket for a couple
Wood to Marsh, 1 run short ball, Marsh presses out and smashes a pull, straight to deep midwicket
Wood to Paine, FOUR runs dug in, Paine takes on the pull and swings it away into the gap between deep square and fine leg for four
Wood to Paine, 1 run back of a length outside off, stabbed through the covers for one
Wood to Marsh, SIX runs full, misses the yorker and it's in the slot, Marsh slams it over wide long-off for six! The extra ball goes all the way, Wood taking some tap at the death!
Rashid to Paine, 2 runs flighted, worked into the leg side and they want two, Willey's throw is poor to the non-striker's end and Marsh dives in!
Rashid to Paine, 2 runs tossed up, Paine lofts a drive over the ring, wide of long-off and they run hard again
Rashid to Paine, 1 run pushed through on the stumps, tapped down the ground
Rashid to Marsh, 1 run dragged down a touch, Marsh swats a pull for one into the deep
Rashid to Paine, 1 run gets it very full, flat enough that Paine can't get under it as he sits on the back foot and swings
Rashid to Marsh, 2 runs pushes through the googly, slapped past extra cover but Willey does well in the deep to prevent four

Plunkett to Paine, 2 runs dropped! Full outside off, Paine slices it high over point... and Moeen can't grasp it on the run! He actually seemed to overrun it, got under the ball but saw it slip through his hands

Plunkett to Paine, OUT short ball, into the body and Paine flips it straight to fine leg! This time the catch is held, a short-lived cameo from Paine but while Marsh is still at the other end Australia can dream. Think that was a cutter from Plunkett, no pace for Paine to work with
Plunkett to Tye, 1 run on the stumps, clipped down the ground for one

Plunkett to Marsh, OUT oh, GONE - bowled 'im! Plunkett hits the woodwork and Australia's best hope of winning walks off after a magnificent century. The crowd rises to applaud him up the steps, probably realising that wicket might have clinched the game... Slower ball from Plunkett, the cutter gripped an
Plunkett to Jhye Richardson, 1 run on the stumps and worked for one
Plunkett to Tye, 1 run pitched up, drilled to mid-off and Root has a chance to throw down the stumps as Tye goes for the single... would have been gone all day but he misses!
Rashid to Tye, 2 runs floated up full, Tye heaves to leg, sends a spiralling top edge up towards midwicket... but it lands safely!
Rashid to Tye, FOUR runs gets this one away, slog-swept behind square and Wood seemingly didn't pick it up! That'll be four, bouncing away over the rope, Rashid left chuntering about the fielding
Rashid to Tye, 2 runs pushed through and chopped for two more off the back foot
Rashid to Jhye Richardson, 1 run pushed through and prodded into the off side
Rashid to Kane Richardson, no run flighted, defended on off stump
England won by 38 runs
Player of the match is Jason Roy, ENG
